Tools for working with Field Indicators of Hydric Soils and related data
text: basic example shows determine area applicability indicator “A9” (also known “1cm Muck”). load MLRA v5.2 database, instance using {terra}, can visualize extent “A9” indicator used (blue), show MLRA excluded (portion LRR P, “South Atlantic Gulf Slope Cash Crops, Forest, Livestock Region”, red):
code: library(hydricsoils)  data(fihs, package = "hydricsoils")  subset(fihs, indicator == "A9", select = c("usage", "usage_symbols", "except_mlra")) #>                                                                                             usage #> 11 For use in LRRs D, F, G, H, P (except for MLRA 136), and T; for testing in LRRs C, I, J, and O #>       usage_symbols except_mlra #> 11 D, F, G, H, P, T         136 library(terra) #> terra 1.7.73 x <- vect("/vsizip//vsicurl/https://www.nrcs.usda.gov/sites/default/files/2022-10/MLRA_52_2022.zip/MLRA_52_2022")  ind <- fihs[fihs$indicator == "A9",] xsub <- subset(x, x$LRRSYM %in% ind[, 'usage_symbols'][[1]]) plot(x, ext = xsub) plot(xsub, add = TRUE, col = "BLUE") plot(xsub[xsub$MLRARSYM %in% unlist(ind$except_mlra),], add = TRUE, col = "RED")

title: Tools for working with Field Indicators of Hydric Soils and related data
text: Next let’s find indicators can used LRR “C” (also known “California Subtropical Fruit, Truck, Specialty Crop Region”) Compare LRR “D” (also known “Western Range Irrigated Region”) outputs match information can find guide Appendix 1. Note main difference LRRs indicator “A5” approved use LRR “C” whereas “A9” approved use LRR “D”. “A9” available testing “C”, , contrast, “A5” neither available, tested, LRR “D”.
code: subset(fihs, sapply(usage_symbols, \(x) any(x == "C")), select = c("indicator", "indicator_name")) #>    indicator              indicator_name #> 3         A1          Histosol or Histel #> 4         A2             Histic Epipedon #> 5         A3                Black Histic #> 6         A4            Hydrogen Sulfide #> 7         A5           Stratified Layers #> 13       A11 Depleted Below Dark Surface #> 14       A12          Thick Dark Surface #> 21        S1         Sandy Mucky Mineral #> 24        S4         Sandy Gleyed Matrix #> 25        S5                 Sandy Redox #> 26        S6             Stripped Matrix #> 33        F1         Loamy Mucky Mineral #> 34        F2         Loamy Gleyed Matrix #> 35        F3             Depleted Matrix #> 36        F6          Redox Dark Surface #> 37        F7       Depleted Dark Surface #> 38        F8           Redox Depressions subset(fihs, sapply(usage_symbols, \(x) any(x == "D")), select = c("indicator", "indicator_name")) #>    indicator              indicator_name #> 3         A1          Histosol or Histel #> 4         A2             Histic Epipedon #> 5         A3                Black Histic #> 6         A4            Hydrogen Sulfide #> 11        A9                   1 cm Muck #> 13       A11 Depleted Below Dark Surface #> 14       A12          Thick Dark Surface #> 21        S1         Sandy Mucky Mineral #> 24        S4         Sandy Gleyed Matrix #> 25        S5                 Sandy Redox #> 26        S6             Stripped Matrix #> 33        F1         Loamy Mucky Mineral #> 34        F2         Loamy Gleyed Matrix #> 35        F3             Depleted Matrix #> 36        F6          Redox Dark Surface #> 37        F7       Depleted Dark Surface #> 38        F8           Redox Depressions
